image.altText: Larissa Ellis

items.synopsis: In the wake of the alleged murder of a woman by her partner in Alice Springs, a leading Northern Territory domestic violence campaigner has called for immediate action to address the sector's "inadequate" funding model.

title.children: NT domestic violence campaigner says sector 'woefully' underfunded after woman's alleged murder

image.altText: Riverine buffalo bull in the Northern Territory standing in a paddock

items.synopsis: A man is recovering in the Royal Darwin Hospital after coming "eyeball to eyeball" with a wild buffalo in a remote part of the territory.

title.children: 'I had my hands on his horn': Buffalo attack leaves man in hospital

image.altText: daniel andrews tours ballarat's eureka stadium at announcement of 2026 commonwealth games

items.synopsis: The Andrews government has scrapped the regional Victorian Commonwealth Games, just 15 months on from announcing it would serve as the 2026 host.

title.children: Australian sport left in limbo as Victoria pulls pin on billions-over-budget Commonwealth Games

image.altText: A woman sits on the ground with two police standing over her, one with handcuffs, as three other people hold her

items.synopsis: An emergency application filed on behalf of traditional custodians has brought bulldozers at Lee Point to a halt over concerns clearing may impact Aboriginal cultural sites.

title.children: Lee Point protesters fined as Defence housing development remains on hold

image.altText: A man with dark hair wears a football jersey and stands against a black background

items.synopsis: Former Wanderer's vice-captain Simon Bates was found guilty of aggravated assault earlier this year, after breaking a man's eye socket near the dance floor at Mayberry nightclub in late 2021.

title.children: NTFL player jailed over Darwin nightclub assault which left victim with fractured skull

image.altText: Two Australian batters and the team captain high-five at the end of a T20 match at the Commonwealth Games.

items.synopsis: Victoria has backed away from its hosting duties in 2026, and now questions are being raised as to what the future holds for the Commonwealth Games.

title.children: The 2026 Commonwealth Games don't have a home, and the event itself is at a crossroads

image.altText: Raw rack of lamb

items.synopsis: If the price of a lamb has seemed expensive this year, it might surprise you to learn that Australia is producing record amounts of it.

title.children: Australia is producing record volumes of lamb. Where is it going?

image.altText: Greg Craven

items.synopsis: A constitutional lawyer who supports the Voice to Parliament says he is likely to complain to the electoral commission, after being quoted in official material for the No case.

title.children: Pro-Voice to Parliament lawyer quoted in official No pamphlet furious at inclusion

items.synopsis: The Yes camp in the Voice to Parliament referendum is relying on endorsements from sporting stars like Johnathan Thurston to shore up support while the No campaign has plenty of backing from former judges.

title.children: Campaign for the Voice uses sport star power while No camp relies on former judges

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair and sunglasses looks down and out of picture without smiling.

items.synopsis: Andrea Groening was sentenced for driving dangerously causing death and dangerous driving causing serious harm after speeding through a red light while under the influence of cannabis and alcohol in May 2019.

title.children: Darwin mum breaches suspended sentence received for killing son, friend in 2019 crash

image.altText: Storm clouds gather over the ocean at dusk.

items.synopsis: The BOM has held off on declaring El Niño yet again, despite most other international agencies having already made the call. So why are we at odds with the rest of the world?

title.children: What's it going to take for Australia to declare El Niño?

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a black shirt staring at the camera.

items.synopsis: Coffs Harbour Councillor Scott Wolgamot has posted a public apology on Facebook, saying he "abhors domestic violence" and regrets making the comment during a debate about a koala reserve.

title.children: 'I should have chosen my words more carefully': NSW councillor 'regrets' domestic violence remark

image.altText: A woman in a red sweater looks at the camera as she leaves a court building followed by a man and another woman

items.synopsis: A couple found guilty of the 2009 murder of their ex-son-in-law will appeal the verdict on a number of grounds, claiming the judge "erred in fact or law" — and that two jurors in a "pre-existing relationship" were not dismissed.

title.children: Convicted murderer couple to appeal guilty verdict over killing of ex-son-in-law

image.altText: The wreckage of a plane crash

items.synopsis: A coronial inquest examining a catastrophic plane crash that killed all on board in Far North Queensland has heard the pilot was flying too low and too fast moments before impact.

title.children: Inquest hears plane flew too fast, too low moments before fatal crash

image.altText: Sheep eat the stubble of a failed wheat crop at sunset.

items.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology maintains its El Niño "alert" status. Look back as our experts answered your questions about what the announcement means.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology maintains El Niño 'alert' status. Our experts have answered your questions

image.altText: A man in a suit sits at a bench with his head down, flagged by a man and woman in business attire, inside a committee room.

items.synopsis: Facing questions on integrity and their own multi-million-dollar salaries, EY executives insist the firm is not like PwC and would not breach confidentiality.

title.children: Fighting calls to break up the 'big four' consulting firms, EY says it's nothing like competitor PwC

image.altText: Emily Mursa and Ben Pears sitting next to each other in front of a sunset

items.synopsis: A woman who had planned her upcoming wedding at Newcastle venue 48 Watt St says she has been left in the dark after the company went into liquidation.

title.children: Young couple $10k out of pocket as popular venue goes into liquidation

image.altText: A man in a black windbreaker, black cap, black sunglasses and white face mask walks next to a man in a barrister's gown.

items.synopsis: A traditional Chinese massage therapist who raped and sexually assaulted six women at his place of work is sentenced to three years and two months in jail, but will only serve 16 months.

title.children: Canberra massage therapist who sexually assaulted six women to serve 16 months in jail

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt walking outside court and a selfie of a woman wearing glasses.

items.synopsis: Two parents who withheld “vital” information from paramedics after their toddler ingested a potentially lethal dose of the party drug fantasy (GHB) will both spend time behind bars.

title.children: Parents of toddler who 'miraculously' survived after ingesting fantasy sent to prison

image.altText: A photo of a toddler with blonde hair and blue eyes looking into the camera.

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury finds Brendan Pallant guilty of the 2019 murder of two-year-old Jaidyn Gomes-Sebastiao, his ex-partner's son.

title.children: Man found guilty of 2019 murder of toddler Jaidyn Gomes-Sebastiao

image.altText: The Sierra Leone-flagged cargo ship, Razoni carrying Ukrainian grain leaves the port, in Odesa

items.synopsis: Food prices spiked after Russia invaded Ukraine, but the Black Sea export deal helped to stabilise them. Now the deal's off, and analysts are warning of a price "roller-coaster".

title.children: What now for global food prices after Russia pulls pin on Black Sea grain deal?

image.altText: A buckled and damaged bridge

items.synopsis: The day started with two mysterious explosions on Putin's beloved Kerch bridge and ended with Russia withdrawing from a crucial deal to allow Ukrainian grain to pass through the Black Sea. Here's everything we know.

title.children: A furious Putin, a busted bridge and a torn-up deal: Russia and Ukraine's wild 24 hours explained

image.altText: A footballer smiles while holding her baby daughter.

items.synopsis: Katrina Gorry reflects on her rollercoaster relationship with football, and how making the decision to become a solo parent helped her fall back in love with football.

title.children: 'I don't even feel like the same person': Matildas star opens up on how motherhood changed her approach to football

image.altText: A close-up man wearing a white shirt

items.synopsis: Victoria Police have agreed to drop criminal charges against North Melbourne player Tarryn Thomas, after the midfielder said he would make a $1,000 donation to charity.

title.children: AFL player Tarryn Thomas threatened to spread 'intimate videos', court told, as charges dropped

image.altText: An older man with white hair and full beard sits on a tree stump.

items.synopsis: The book Dark Emu ignited a culture war that became extremely personal, with questions raised over Pascoe's Indigenous heritage. The pressure contributed to his separation from his wife.

title.children: Controversy over Dark Emu took a heavy toll on author Bruce Pascoe

image.altText: A man in a fishing shirt and hat stands on a beach

items.synopsis: It's not yet clear whether the dingoes involved in the latest attack that took place on K'gari will the euthanased.

title.children: Reports dingoes becoming more brazen, as fate of animals involved in attack on jogger hangs in the balance

image.altText: A composite image of Jim Chalmers and Philip Lowe.

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank left interest rates on hold this month on fears that another rise could trigger a spike in unemployment, as the outgoing governor calls for politicians to tackle difficult productivity reforms.

title.children: 'Still risks everywhere': RBA left rates on hold amid fears of an unemployment spike

image.altText: Image of lifeguard in water with dead whale and jetski

items.synopsis: North Wollongong Beach will remain closed after a dead whale was discovered and towed towards Port Kembla to be removed from the water and buried.

title.children: Beach closed for at least 24 hours due to shark risk as small, dead whale towed from Wollongong waters

image.altText: A pile of broken down Barbie dolls.

items.synopsis: Toys are the most plastic-intensive consumer goods in the world. So how can we avoid movie tie-in fads adding to the surging plastic waste problem, asks Alan Pears.

title.children: After the Barbie movie frenzy fades, how do we avoid tonnes of Barbie dolls going to landfill?

image.altText: Taylor swift in a gold body suit singing into a microphone with a male dancer behind her

items.synopsis: Taylor Swift topples previous record holder Barbra Streisand with the release of Speak Now (Taylor's Version).

title.children: Taylor Swift now has the most number-one albums of any female artist in history
